metadata.title: Pixel Pilot Help Resources & Documentation
metadata.author: Anye Happiness Ade
metadata.description: Comprehensive help resources for Pixel Pilot AI App Builder platform

categories.title: Getting Started
categories.description: Essential guides to help you begin your journey with Pixel Pilot

articles.title: Platform Overview
articles.description: Understand what Pixel Pilot is and how it can transform your app development workflow

content.introduction: Pixel Pilot is a revolutionary AI-powered app development platform that allows you to create web applications by simply chatting with AI. Built with Next.js, TypeScript, and integrated with powerful tools like E2B sandboxes and deployment platforms.
key_features: AI-Powered Development through natural language conversations
Real-time Preview system with E2B sandbox environments
Modern tech stack with automatic template generation
Professional code editor with syntax highlighting
content.target_audience: Developers, entrepreneurs, designers, and anyone who wants to build web applications quickly and efficiently

articles.title: Quick Start Guide
articles.description: Get up and running with your first Pixel Pilot project in under 10 minutes

prerequisites: GitHub account for authentication and deployment
Basic understanding of web development concepts
Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

step_by_step_setup.title: Create Your Account
step_by_step_setup.description: Sign up using GitHub OAuth for secure authentication
step_by_step_setup.details: Click the 'Get Started' button and authorize with GitHub. This provides secure access and enables deployment features.

step_by_step_setup.title: Create Your First Project
step_by_step_setup.description: Start a new project with our pre-built Vite React template
step_by_step_setup.details: Click 'New Project', enter a name, and Pixel Pilot automatically generates a complete React application with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and essential dependencies.

step_by_step_setup.title: Chat with AI to Build
step_by_step_setup.description: Describe your app idea in natural language
step_by_step_setup.details: In the chat panel, describe what you want to build. For example: 'Create a task management app with user authentication and real-time updates.'

step_by_step_setup.title: Preview Your App
step_by_step_setup.description: See your app come to life instantly
step_by_step_setup.details: Click the preview tab to launch an E2B sandbox environment. Your app will be running in under 2 minutes with hot reload enabled.

step_by_step_setup.title: Deploy to Production
step_by_step_setup.description: Share your app with the world
step_by_step_setup.details: Connect your GitHub account and deploy to Vercel or Netlify with one click. Get a production URL in under 5 minutes.

tips: Start with simple projects to learn the platform
Use the chat panel to ask questions about implementation details
Save frequently and take advantage of auto-backup features
Join the community to see examples from other users

categories.title: AI Development Features
categories.description: Master the AI-powered development capabilities of Pixel Pilot

articles.title: AI Chat & Code Generation
articles.description: Learn how to effectively communicate with AI to generate high-quality code

ai_models.name: Codestral
ai_models.capabilities: Advanced code generation, debugging assistance, and technical explanations
ai_models.use_cases: Complex application logic, API integrations, performance optimization

ai_models.name: GPT-4
ai_models.capabilities: General purpose AI with strong reasoning and creative problem-solving
ai_models.use_cases: UI/UX design suggestions, feature planning, user experience optimization

chat_best_practices: Be specific about your requirements and constraints
Provide context about your existing codebase
Break complex requests into smaller, manageable tasks
Ask for explanations when you don't understand code
Request tests and documentation along with implementation
Use follow-up questions to refine and improve code
effective_prompts: Instead of 'Make a login page' say 'Create a responsive login page with email/password authentication, remember me option, and proper error handling'
Instead of 'Add a dashboard' say 'Build an admin dashboard with charts, user statistics, and real-time data updates using React and a charting library'
Instead of 'Fix this bug' say 'The login form is not validating email addresses correctly. The regex pattern needs to be updated to handle common email formats'
advanced_features: Context-aware code generation using your project files
Streaming responses for real-time code development
File-specific editing with precise search and replace
Automatic error detection and debugging assistance

articles.title: AI Agent Development System
articles.description: Harness the power of our advanced AI agent for autonomous development

agent_modes.name: Plan Mode
agent_modes.description: AI analyzes your requirements and creates detailed implementation plans
agent_modes.when_to_use: Complex projects, multi-step implementations, team coordination
agent_modes.benefits: Structured approach, comprehensive planning, clear milestones

agent_modes.name: Build Mode
agent_modes.description: AI executes plans and creates actual code and files
agent_modes.when_to_use: Implementation phase, code generation, rapid development
agent_modes.benefits: Fast execution, automated file creation, consistent code quality

capabilities: Request Analysis: Understands complex requirements and breaks them down
Implementation Planning: Creates step-by-step development roadmaps
File Operations: Creates, edits, deletes, and renames files automatically
Dependency Management: Adds, removes, and updates packages intelligently
Error Handling: Comprehensive error detection and recovery mechanisms
Code Quality: Follows best practices and maintains consistency
advanced_usage: Database schema design and migration scripts
Testing strategy and test file generation
best_practices: Start with clear, detailed requirements in Plan Mode
Review AI-generated plans before switching to Build Mode
Use specific technical requirements and constraints
Request comprehensive testing and error handling
Iterate on AI suggestions with follow-up requests

categories.title: Development Tools
categories.description: Master the development environment and tools within Pixel Pilot

articles.title: Code Editor & File Management
articles.description: Learn to use the professional code editor and manage your project files effectively

editor_features: Monaco Editor (same engine as VS Code) with full syntax highlighting
Find and replace across files with regex support
Multiple cursor editing and keyboard shortcuts
file_operations: Create new files and folders with right-click context menus
Drag and drop to reorganize file structure
File type detection and appropriate icons
Search across all files with advanced filters
File size monitoring and optimization suggestions
keyboard_shortcuts: Ctrl+F / Cmd+F: Find in current file
Ctrl+Shift+F / Cmd+Shift+F: Find across all files
productivity_tips: Use the file explorer to maintain organized project structure
Take advantage of auto-save to prevent data loss
Use search functionality to quickly navigate large codebases
Create templates for commonly used file structures
Use version control integration for change tracking
Regularly review and refactor file organization

articles.title: Live Preview & Testing
articles.description: Master the E2B-powered preview system for instant app testing

preview_capabilities: E2B sandbox environments for isolated testing
Hot reload for instant code changes
getting_started: Click the 'Preview' tab in the main workspace
Wait for E2B sandbox initialization (typically 1-2 minutes)
Your app will automatically start and be accessible via URL
Make code changes to see instant updates
Use developer tools for debugging and inspection
advanced_features: Custom environment variables for different deployment stages
Database connection testing with mock data
API endpoint testing with request/response logging
Load testing with simulated user traffic
troubleshooting: If preview fails to start, check console for error messages
Ensure all dependencies are properly installed
Verify network connectivity for E2B services
Monitor resource usage to avoid sandbox limits
Clear cache and restart preview for persistent issues
best_practices: Test on multiple devices and screen sizes
Use preview for iterative development cycles
Test error scenarios and edge cases

categories.title: Deployment & Integration
categories.description: Learn to deploy your applications and integrate with external services

articles.title: GitHub Integration & Version Control
articles.description: Connect your projects to GitHub for version control and collaboration

setup_process: Connect your GitHub account via OAuth
Authorize Pixel Pilot to access repositories
Choose repository creation or connect existing repo
features: Automatic repository creation with proper structure
Git commit history and version tracking
Branch management and pull request support
Code review workflows and approval processes
Issue tracking and project management integration
best_practices: Use descriptive commit messages for better tracking
Create feature branches for new developments
Regularly pull changes from main branch
Use pull requests for code review and collaboration
Document changes in commit messages and PR descriptions
troubleshooting: Check GitHub OAuth permissions if connection fails
Verify repository access and organization permissions
Resolve merge conflicts with AI assistance

articles.title: Deployment to Production
articles.description: Deploy your applications to Vercel, Netlify, or other platforms

supported_platforms.name: Vercel
supported_platforms.description: Optimized for Next.js applications with global CDN
supported_platforms.best_for: Next.js apps, SPAs, API routes, edge functions

supported_platforms.name: Netlify
supported_platforms.description: Flexible deployment with form handling and functions
supported_platforms.features: Form processing, serverless functions, identity management

supported_platforms.name: GitHub Pages
supported_platforms.description: Free hosting for static websites and documentation
supported_platforms.features: Automatic deployment from GitHub, custom domains

deployment_process: Configure build settings and environment variables
Set up custom domains and SSL certificates
Set up error tracking and monitoring
environment_management: Feature flags and A/B testing setup

categories.title: Project Management
categories.description: Organize and manage your projects effectively within Pixel Pilot

articles.title: Project Organization & Structure
articles.description: Learn best practices for organizing your project files and folders

recommended_structure.organization: Group by feature or type (buttons, forms, layout)
Follow URL structure for easy navigation

file_naming_conventions: Use index.ts files for clean imports
code_organization_principles: Documentation and comments for complex logic

articles.title: Team Collaboration & Workflows
articles.description: Work effectively with teams using Pixel Pilot's collaboration features

permission_system: Owner: Full control over project and settings
Admin: Can manage team members and deployments
Developer: Can edit code and deploy to staging
Viewer: Read-only access to project files
Guest: Limited access for specific features
workflow_best_practices: Set up automated testing and CI/CD
Regular team standups and progress updates

categories.title: Troubleshooting & Support
categories.description: Common issues and their solutions for Pixel Pilot users

articles.title: Common Issues & Solutions
articles.description: Quick fixes for frequently encountered problems

authentication_issues.solution: Check GitHub app permissions, clear browser cache, try different browser
authentication_issues.prevention: Keep GitHub tokens valid and app permissions up to date

authentication_issues.solution: Check browser cookie settings, ensure stable internet connection
authentication_issues.prevention: Use stable network connection and avoid clearing cookies

code_generation_problems.solution: Provide more specific requirements, include code examples, break into smaller tasks
code_generation_problems.prevention: Use detailed prompts with context and examples

code_generation_problems.problem: Code doesn't match existing project structure
code_generation_problems.solution: Include current file structure in prompts, request integration with existing code
code_generation_problems.prevention: Maintain consistent project structure and naming conventions

preview_system_issues.solution: Check internet connection, wait for E2B initialization, check console for errors
preview_system_issues.prevention: Ensure stable connection and sufficient system resources

preview_system_issues.solution: Restart preview, check file save status, verify file paths
preview_system_issues.prevention: Save files properly and maintain correct file structure

deployment_failures.solution: Check build logs, verify dependencies, ensure correct build commands
deployment_failures.prevention: Test locally before deployment, keep dependencies updated

deployment_failures.solution: Verify variable names, check platform-specific formats, ensure proper encoding
deployment_failures.prevention: Document environment requirements and test configurations

articles.title: Performance Optimization Guide
articles.description: Improve your app's performance and user experience

frontend_optimization: Code splitting and lazy loading for faster initial load
Image optimization and modern formats (WebP, AVIF)
Bundle analysis and tree shaking to reduce bundle size
Caching strategies for static assets and API responses
Minification and compression for production builds
react_best_practices: Implement useMemo and useCallback for expensive operations
Optimize re-renders with proper key props
Use React Suspense for code splitting
backend_optimization: Caching with Redis or similar solutions
API response compression and efficient serialization
Background job processing for heavy operations
CDN integration for global content delivery
monitoring_tools: Web Vitals for Core Web Vitals monitoring

questions.question: What is Pixel Pilot and who is it for?
questions.answer: Pixel Pilot is an AI-powered web development platform that allows anyone to create applications by chatting with AI. It's designed for developers, entrepreneurs, designers, and anyone who wants to build web applications quickly and efficiently, regardless of their coding experience level.

questions.question: Do I need coding experience to use Pixel Pilot?
questions.answer: While some basic understanding of web development concepts is helpful, you don't need extensive coding experience. The AI assistant will guide you through the process and generate code based on your natural language descriptions. However, familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript concepts will help you get the most out of the platform.

questions.question: What technologies does Pixel Pilot support?
questions.answer: Pixel Pilot supports modern web technologies including React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Node.js. It can generate full-stack applications with databases, APIs, and deployment configurations for Vercel, Netlify, and other platforms.

questions.question: How does the AI code generation work?
questions.answer: Our AI system analyzes your natural language descriptions and generates production-ready code. It understands context from your existing project files, follows best practices, and can create everything from simple components to complex full-stack applications with proper error handling and testing.

questions.question: Can I preview my app before deploying?
questions.answer: Yes! Pixel Pilot includes a powerful preview system using E2B sandboxes. You can see your app running in real-time with hot reload, test it on different devices, and debug issues before deploying to production.

questions.question: What deployment options are available?
questions.answer: We support deployment to major platforms including Vercel, Netlify, and GitHub Pages. You can also export your project files for deployment to any hosting service. The deployment process is streamlined with automatic configuration and monitoring.

questions.question: How much does Pixel Pilot cost?
questions.answer: Pixel Pilot offers flexible pricing plans. We have a generous free tier for getting started, and paid plans for teams and advanced features. Visit our pricing page for current rates and feature comparisons.

questions.question: Is there a free trial available?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer a free trial that includes access to core features, limited AI usage, and basic deployment options. This allows you to experience the platform and build small projects before upgrading to a paid plan.

questions.question: What features are included in the free plan?
questions.answer: The free plan includes basic AI chat, project creation with templates, preview functionality, and deployment to free hosting tiers. Paid plans unlock higher AI usage limits, advanced features, team collaboration, and priority support.

questions.question: How do I get help if I encounter issues?
questions.answer: We provide multiple support channels: comprehensive documentation, community forums, email support, and priority support for paid users. Our AI assistant can also help troubleshoot common issues within the platform.

questions.question: Is my code and data secure?
questions.answer: Security is our top priority. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest. We use industry-standard security practices, regular security audits, and comply with data protection regulations. Your code remains yours, and we don't train our AI models on your private projects.

questions.question: Can I export my projects?
questions.answer: Yes, you can export your complete project files at any time. This includes all code, configurations, and assets. You maintain full ownership and can use the exported files however you wish, including deploying to other platforms or continuing development elsewhere.

terms.definition: An autonomous AI system that can analyze requirements, plan implementations, and execute development tasks automatically.
Isolated development environments that provide secure, instant previews of applications with full system access.
Technology that automatically updates the running application when code changes are made, without requiring a full restart.
The code editor engine used by Visual Studio Code, providing professional editing features and syntax highlighting.
Open Authorization protocol that allows secure third-party access to user accounts without sharing passwords.
A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing and advanced features for better code quality and developer experience.
A utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes for rapid UI development.
A React framework that provides server-side rendering, static site generation, and optimized performance features.
A fast build tool and development server that provides instant hot reload and optimized production builds.
